chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael R Herbert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13 [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • Incest with Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.06(1).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).
  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with all other sentences (Counts 2, 3, 5 and the Missouri cases).

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $1,760.00 to the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
  25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

No contact with the victim or the victims parents unless approved by the parents and the agent.
No contact with minors without prior agent approval.

Complete Sex Offender Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations and/or compy with all treatment recommendations for treatment he's already received while confined. 
Comply with any other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by the DOC.
Sign all necessary releases with regards to assessments, medications, pharmacies or treatment. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Placed on lifetime Sex Offender Supervision.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing held on January 5, 2016
Corrected to add the DNA surcharge to Count 3.

Defendant Michael R Herbert in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Michael R Herbert in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:28 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  There are no corrections or additions. 

J.K. appears by telephone.  
Court questions J.K. re: appearing in person vs. telephone. 
J.K. makes victim impact statement to the Court. 

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court questions probation agent. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

Court questions parties re: jail credit.

BY THE COURT:  
All 4 sentences will be run concurrent
Count 1 - 
Serve 25 years prison with 15 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years Extended Supervision.  Concurrent with all other sentences (Counts 2, 3 & 5 and Missouri cases). 
No contact with the victim or the victims parents unless approved by the parents and the agent.
No contact with minors without prior agent approval.
Complete Sex Offender Assessment and comply with treatment recommendations and/or compy with all treatment recommendations for treatment he's already received while confined. 
Comply with any other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by the DOC.
Sign all necessary releases with regards to assessments, medications, pharmacies or treatment. 
Pay restitution of $1,760.00 to the Crime Victim Compensation Program. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Pay court costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Submit a DNA sample. 
Placed on lifetime sex offender supervision.

Count 2 - 
Serve 25 years prison with 15 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years Extended Supervision.  Concurrent with all other sentences (Counts 1, 3 & 5 and Missouri cases). 
112 days credit. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Conditions are identical to Count 1. 

Count 3 - 
Serve 25 years prison with 15 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years Extended Supervision.  Concurrent with all other sentences (Counts 1, 2 & 5 and Missouri cases). 
112 days credit. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Conditions are identical to Count 1. 

Count 5 - 
Serve 25 years prison with 15 years Initial Confinement followed by 10 years Extended Supervision.  Concurrent with all other sentences (Counts 1, 2 & 5 and Missouri cases). 
112 days credit. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Conditions are identical to Count 1. 

Not eligible for Earned Release or Challenge Incarceration programs. 
Atty Wallace makes statements.  Does not object to the restitution amount.  Makes statements re: VIS. 

Parties retain the PSI in their files confidentially.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 01-05-2016 02:00 pm

Defendant Michael R Herbert in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Michael R Herbert in custody. Louis Molepske Jr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:18 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter has been set for a jury trial the week after next. There has been a resolution.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, there is  a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 1 - initial confinement of 10 yrs prison sentence concurrent to Missouri. Parties free to argue. One term of lifetime supervision.
Defendant will plead to Count 2 - initial confinement of  8 1/2 yrs prison sentence concurrent to Count 1 and to Missouri. Parties free to argue.
Defendant will plead to Count 3 -initial confinement of 10 yrs prison sentence concurrent to Count 2 and Count 1 and to Missouri. Parties free to argue.
Defendant will plead to Count 5 - initial confinement of 10 yrs prison sentence concurrent to Count 3, Count 2 and Count 1 but consecutive to Missouri. Parties free to argue.
Count 4, Count 6, and Count 7 would be dismissed and read in.

Parties request a PSI.

Atty Wallace concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY to Count 1
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY to Count 2
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY to Count 3
Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY to Count 5

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. 
Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Wallace for Defendant.
Atty Wallace has discussed all plea bargains with his client.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court regarding Count 1, lifetime supervision above and beyond registry of sex offender.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: contrary to the statute section stated therein   939.615(2)(a)    939.615(1)(b1)
Count 2: contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 4: Dismissed and Read In
Count 5: contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 6: Dismissed and Read In
Count 7: Dismissed and Read In

BY THE COURT:
Court orders that a PSI be prepared. PSI to be completed by December 29, 2015. Copies will be forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments. 
Court orders that bond be revoked.

Atty Molepske states that victims will be present or at least a representative of the family will be present, for the sentencing hearing.
Parties discuss time needed for the hearing.

BY THE COURT:
State is no longer to submit the additional information as stated on the record.

4:38 PM Court is adjourned for the day.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 11-20-2015 11:30 am

2:48 p.m. Defendant Michael R Herbert in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Michael R Herbert in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motions are heard today.
State's Motion for use of Video Tape Wis. Stat. 908.08 (2 recordings). DA Molepski makes statements in support of motion. Atty Wallace has no objection, subject to cross examination of the witness. BTC: The Video 2 interviews will be admitted.
Parties address the State's Motion in limine on the record.
BTC: 
#1. All witness to be sequestered.  
#2. Police Officer/Detective will be allowed to be present with the State. 
#3. Granted
#4. Granted. Answer is 3.
#5. Granted
#6. Granted
#7. Granted, but Court retains the right depending on circumstances.
#8. Granted without objection
#9. Granted
#10. Granted
Further verbal motion made by DA Molepski. BTC: Motion to be provided in written form and will be addressed at a later date.

Parties address the State's Motion to Introduce Other Acts Evidence Pursuant to the Recently Revised Wis. Stat. 904.04 on the record.
BTC:  The Court will admit the Other Acts Evidence.
DA Molepski to supplement for further review to the Court and parties of the out-of-state statutes as to the prior convictions.
3:52 p.m. Court in recess
Filed date is 10-19-15

Motion hearing at 10-30-2015 02:30 pm.

Motion hearing at 10-19-2015 10:30 am.
Arraignment at 10-19-2015 10:30 am.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
State requests 30 days to file the Information.  Atty Renc had filed a motion to dismiss counts 7 & 8.  

Deadline for filing motions is set for October 9, 2015.
